question:
A company wants to migrate its web applications from on premises to AWS. The company is located close to the eu-central-1 Region. Because of regulations, the company cannot launch some of its applications in eu-central-1. The company wants to achieve single-digit millisecond latency.

Which solution will meet these requirements?

options.A: Deploy the applications in eu-central-1. Extend the company's VPC from eu-central-1 to an edge location in Amazon CloudFront.
options.B: Deploy the applications in AWS Local Zones by extending the company's VPC from eu-central-1 to the chosen Local Zone.
options.C: Deploy the applications in eu-central-1. Extend the company's VPC from eu-central-1 to the regional edge caches in Amazon CloudFront.
options.D: Deploy the applications in AWS Wavelength Zones by extending the company's VPC from eu-central-1 to the chosen Wavelength Zone.

explanation: AWS Local Zones extend AWS infrastructure closer to end users for single-digit millisecond latency while keeping regulatory compliance (applications run outside the main region). Local Zones are extensions of the parent region's VPC. Wavelength is for 5G mobile edge computing.
